column4: Hi all I'm having an issue with my GeForce 360GM on a toshiba x505. I have the nvidia drivers installed. Already ran nvidia-xconfig. I don't get any video output to my external lcd monitor using HDMI cable

I checked the nvidia settings and it shows both displays. I can't figure out how to get the 23"lcd to work? On boot I do see output booting with grub. Up to the point where I get a 10.10 splash with the dots. It stays there for a second then disappears. I hear the audio on the sytem. Just not video. How do I disable the laptop display and enable the other?
on ur laptop do you have an fn button ?
well idk what it looks like on ur pc button on the top part do you have a button for changing to an external monitor
Yes...what keystroke do I need to try? They are listed as DFP-0 and DFP-1 in nvidia settings
hold that fn key and find the monitor button
Ah so you think there is a monitor button on the keyboard?
Yes I found it...F5 but still no joy...
hold fn and hit it you might have to hit it several times and how are you connecting this ?
does the tv show the manufacturer info and such in the nvidia area
Yes it recognizes it is there.
idk then check everything in nvidia settings and check ur ubuntu settings.
